The New York–based nonprofit the Museum of Modern Art (MoMA) in New York announced today that it plans to open a new chapter in its collection by donating approximately twenty works by seventy-nine artists to the institution. The museum will donate twenty-five works by artists who were active in the 1960s to the institute, which is currently restoring a portion of the collection.
